```{python}
#| label: fig-ofdm-transceiver
#| echo: false
#| fig-cap: "OFDM transmission system block diagram showing transmitter and receiver processing chains."

import schemdraw as sd
import schemdraw.elements as elm
import schemdraw.dsp as dsp

sd.svgconfig.svg2 = False

with sd.Drawing(canvas='svg') as d:
    d.config(unit=2, fontsize=14)

    elm.Dot(open=True).label(r'Bitrate $T_\mathrm{b}$', loc='left')
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Square().label('S/P')
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2).label(r'$T_\mathrm{b} / N$')
    dsp.Square().label('QAM\nMap')
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Square().label('IFFT')
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Square().label('P/S')
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Square().label('Add\nCP')
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Square().label('Radio')
    dsp.Line().right(d.unit/2)
    elm.Antenna()
    
    # Move down for receiver chain
    d.move(dx=-d.unit*7, dy=-d.unit*1.5)
    
    # Receiver chain (bottom row)
    elm.Antenna()
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Square().label('Radio')
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Square().label('Rem.\nCP')
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Square().label('S/P')
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Square().label('FFT')
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Square().label('EQ')
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2)
    dsp.Square().label('QAM\nDem.')
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2).label(r'$T_\mathrm{b} / N$')
    dsp.Square().label('P/S')
    dsp.Arrow().right(d.unit/2)
    elm.Dot(open=True).label(r'Bitrate $T_\mathrm{b}$', loc='right')
```
